articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: SOL has dropped a further 29% this month after taking a hard hit amid the FTX collapse, plus Solana’s top NFT projects are moving on.
articles.title: Solana Sinks Below $10 for First Time in Nearly Two Years

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: In our first half recap of the year in crypto, we run back FTX's massive valuation, OpenSea's peak, Terra's collapse, and regulatory talk.
articles.title: The Year in Crypto, 2022 Part 1: NFTs Peak, Terra Tumbles, Musk Buys Twitter

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Michael Saylor’s software company framed the sale as being for “tax benefits,” but its appetite for amassing Bitcoin hasn’t yet waned.
articles.title: MicroStrategy Sells Off Bitcoin for First Time—Then Buys Even More

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: It is currently unclear who was behind the latest transfers from crypto wallets associated with Alameda Research.
articles.title: Alameda-Linked Addresses Begin Swapping Ethereum, ERC-20 Tokens for Bitcoin

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: America’s largest crypto exchange Coinbase looks to be ending the year on a somber note amid falling revenues and profits.
articles.title: Coinbase Stock Hits New Lows, Plummets 6% in Five Days

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: A new lawsuit against the now-bankrupt FTX exchange argues that any assets recovered should be “earmarked solely for customers.”
articles.title: FTX Lawsuit Says Burned Users ‘Should Not Have to Stand in Line’ With Other Creditors

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: A class-action lawsuit alleges Gemini sold interest-bearing accounts that it failed to register as securities.
articles.title: Investors Sue Gemini, Winklevoss Twins Over High-Yield Earn Products

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Eisenberg has been charged with commodities fraud and commodities manipulation for his role in the $110 million Mango Markets exploit.
articles.title: Mango Markets Attacker Avraham Eisenberg Arrested, Charged With 'Market-Manipulation Offenses'

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: In addition to the $65 million sale to Galaxy, Argo is also grabbing a $35 million loan backed by more than 23,000 mining machines.
articles.title: Bitcoin Miner Argo Blockchain Sells Texas Facility to Galaxy Digital for $65M

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: A loan from Alameda Research funded the purchase of shares now sought by BlockFi.
articles.title: SBF Filing Details $546 Million Purchase of Robinhood Shares

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: A “no-nonsense” Manhattan judge who has handled a number of high-profile cases will now oversee SBF’s.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Will Face Judge Who Presided Over Trump, Kevin Spacey

articles.author: Stephen Graves
articles.description: Crypto advertisements exploded onto our streets and screens in 2022—but the crypto crash meant that many of them have aged badly.
articles.title: The Crypto Ads That Made Waves in 2022

articles.description: Zora sees itself as more than just an NFT marketplace; its next era is about helping people easily launch a DAO. Zora Co-founder Jacob Horne joined Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward to talk competition, the NFT speculative boom and bust, how Zora and Nouns are connected, and why Zora thinks DAOs are the future. Watch Episode 27 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Zora Looks Beyond NFTs to DAO Creation

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Cybersecurity firm Kapersky says BlueNoroff's newest malware can circumvent Mark-of-the-Web (MOTW) security measures.
articles.title: North Korea-Linked Lazarus Group Poses as VC Firms to Spread Malware

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Japanese crypto exchanges may welcome stablecoins like Tether (USDT) or USD Coin (USDC) as early as next year.
articles.title: Japan Mulls Reversing Ban on Foreign-Issued Stablecoins: Report

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: Argo Blockchain is suspending trading of its shares, with the Bitcoin miner indicating that it has a significant announcement on Wednesday.
articles.title: Bitcoin Miner Argo Blockchain Suspends Trading on NASDAQ

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: Octopus joins firms like Coinbase and OpenSea, who have all made big cuts to staff numbers in 2022 amid the challenging market environment.
articles.title: NEAR Protocol Project Octopus Network Lays Off 40% of Team

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: The FTX crisis has put even more heat on centralized crypto exchanges. What if they went away entirely, leaving only DeFi?
articles.title: What Would Crypto Look Like Without Centralized Exchanges Like FTX?

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: New trademark applications suggest the investment giant is ready to step up its game in crypto, eyeing new opportunities in the metaverse.
articles.title: Fidelity Wants to Give Investment Advice in the Metaverse Say Trademark Filings

articles.author: Ryan Ozawa
articles.description: Misleading financial statements hid just how entangled Alameda and FTX finances were.
articles.title: Caroline Ellison 'Knew That It Was Wrong,' Implicates Sam Bankman Fried

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The “Shark Tank” host also said he wants Bitcoin’s price to fall more—so he can buy more.
articles.title: Mark Cuban Doubles Down on Bitcoin While Dissing Gold

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The ex-president says he didn't do it for the money—but still thought his NFTs "might sell."
articles.title: Donald Trump Says He Launched NFTs for the 'Sort of Cute' Art

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: If 2022 taught us anything, it's that we are not all "gonna make it." These NFT traders and creators learned some tough lessons this year.
articles.title: 'Bag Fumble of the Century': Biggest Ls in NFTs in 2022

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Crypto lender Nexo insists it is still in talks with rival Vauld over potential acquisition of the Singapore-based company.
articles.title: Nexo Says It 'Has Not Given Up' On Bailout for Rival Crypto Lender Vauld

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: This year, heavy industry-wide losses from Bitcoin to the now-collapsed FTX exchange drove crypto fans to seek refuge in humor.
articles.title: Laughing Through Tears: Crypto Memes of The Year

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: The phishing scheme used a web of over 500 fraudulent websites to extract key information from NFT users during the minting process.
articles.title: North Korea-linked NFT Phishing Campaign Targets OpenSea, X2Y2, Rarible Users

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Amid the ongoing hack, the BitKeep team advised its users to move their funds to official Google Play or App Store wallets.
articles.title: Crypto Wallet Bitkeep Points to Malicious APK Packages for Multi-Million-Dollar Exploit

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: As extreme weather conditions left more than one million without power on Friday, several U.S.-based Bitcoin miners have paused operations.
articles.title: Bitcoin Hash Rate Suffers Near 40% Drop Amid U.S. Deadly Winter Storm

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: Coins are limping into the new year. And in its investigation of FTX’s collapse, the SEC appears to have redoubled its assault on crypto.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin, Ethereum See Modest Gains Heading Into Christmas

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: Not everyone misbehaved in cryptoland this year. Here are the leaders who made Santa's nice list in crypto in 2022.
articles.title: Santa's Crypto ‘Nice’ List 2022

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: It was a turbulent year for crypto. Here’s who Santa tells Decrypt will get coal in their stockings this holiday season.
articles.title: Santa's Crypto 'Naughty' List 2022

articles.author: Ben Munster
articles.description: After the collapse of FTX, Web3 VCs say they believe in decentralized tech as much as ever. What the hell else can they say?
articles.title: Crypto Is Down Bad, But VCs Keep Pouring Money In

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: Bankman-Fried will be assigned a new judge in his criminal trial after the initial judge disclosed a “possible conflict.”
articles.title: Judge in SBF Case Recuses Herself Over Husband’s Firm’s Past Work for FTX

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: OpenSea says it's enforcing U.S. policy by booting from its NFT marketplace Cuban and other NFT artists from sanctioned countries.
articles.title: NFT Marketplace OpenSea Confirms Ban on Cuban Artists

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: Last year was bad, but 2022 was much worse, "the biggest year ever for hacking."
articles.title: Biggest Crypto Exploits and Hacks of 2022

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: From Apes to big brands to creator royalties, all amid a rollercoaster market, these are the trends that defined the year in NFTs.
articles.title: The Biggest NFT Moments of 2022

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: According to South Korea's main spy agency, North Korea is suspected of using these funds for its nuclear and missile programs.
articles.title: North Korean Hackers Have Stolen $1.2B in Crypto Since 2017

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: OKX joins a long list of crypto firms rushing to prove their stability, but regulators continue to question the reliability of such reports.
articles.title: OKX Proof-of-Reserve Report Shows 101% Bitcoin, Tether Reserves

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: Given the list of creditors claiming the Robinhood shares, FTX asked the court to wait for a "fair" solution to be determined.
articles.title: FTX Urges Bankruptcy Court to Freeze $450M in Robinhood Shares Owed to Creditors

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: Bullish joins a number of firms that have scrapped their SPAC aspirations amid an uncertain regulatory climate for crypto firms.
articles.title: Peter Thiel-backed Crypto Exchange Bullish Calls Off $9B SPAC Plan

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: Today's bullish move comes just a day after Bitstamp listed Dogecoin. Still, it's a drop in the river after DOGE's month-long descent.
articles.title: Dogecoin Enjoys 5% Rebound After Month-Long Tumble

articles.description: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman talks about how the Tezos blockchain has used a proof-of-stake mechanism since its inception, her admiration for Tendermint, Ethereum and sharding, progressive decentralization, and NFT gaming with Decrypt's Stephen Graves onstage at Web Summit in Lisbon.
articles.title: How Tezos Was Ahead of the Proof-of-Stake Merge: Web Summit 2022

articles.description: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has been an outspoken advocate for crypto and a candid critic of her own agency’s approach to regulating crypto markets. In an extensive chat with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott she discussed FTX, Gary Gensler, DeFi, and the problems with the Howey Test. Don’t miss this conversation for the inside take on the SEC’s thinking on crypto—straight from the source. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Critiques SEC's Approach to Crypto

articles.description: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman has been in crypto since the beginning and has seen a lot of cycles and failures. She joined Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts and brought the fire on FTX and Sam Bankman-Fried’s mismanagement, “decentralization theater,” Tezos’s reputation and positioning, crypto sports marketing, and NFTs. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Tezos Co-Founder Kathleen Breitman Sounds Off on FTX Collapse

articles.description: Clay Robbins of Slow Ventures, Soona Amhaz of Volt Capital, Sarah Guo of Conviction and formerly Greylock, and Alex Strzesniewski of AngelBlock joined Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Summit in San Francisco on November 3 for an extensive panel on raising venture money even during Crypto Winter.
articles.title: Raising in a Bear Market: Slow Ventures, Volt Capital, Conviction, AngelBlock at 0xpo Summit

articles.description: Illa Da Producer accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Yuga Labs from presenter Alanna Roazzi-Laforet at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Moonbirds, Azuki, DeGods, and CloneX.
articles.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Bored Ape Yacht Club Wins NFT Project of the Year

articles.description: Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon accepted the industry achievement award from presenter Clara Tsao of Filecoin Foundation at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30.
articles.title: The Crypties 2022: Art Blocks Founder Wins Industry Achievement Award

articles.description: Rachel Weiss and Jackie Courtney accepted the Cryptie for BFF from presenter Rebecca Barkin of Lamina1 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were WomenRise, Boys Club, and The Hug.
articles.title: The Crypties 2022: BFF Wins Diversity Award

articles.description: Katrina Wolfe accepted the Cryptie for Crypto Unicorns from presenter Avery Akkineni of Vayner3 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Stepn, Zed Run, and Blankos Block Party.
articles.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Crypto Unicorns Wins Game of the Year

articles.description: Marek Olszewski accepted the Cryptie for Celo from presenter Dan Roberts of Decrypt Media at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Ukraine DAO, Dream DAO, Proof of Protest, and Digital Diaspora.
articles.title: The Crypties 2022: Celo Wins Social Impact Award

articles.description: Simone Berry and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie for People of Crypto's Metaverse Pride Parade from presenter Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.
articles.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: People of Crypto Wins Metaverse Event of the Year

articles.description: Shirley Cedeno and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Doodles from presenters Igor Lilic and Gabriela Ramos Lilic of Breakout at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were RTFKT and Nike, Gmoney and Adidas, Tiffany and CryptoPunks, and TIMEpieces.
articles.title: The Crypties 2022: Doodles Collab With Shopify Wins Mainstream Award

articles.description: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.
articles.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year

articles.description: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.
articles.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year

articles.description: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's business—plus misconceptions in the crypto space.
articles.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads

articles.description: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.
articles.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch

articles.description: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what he’s looking forward to in Web3.
articles.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
